page.title: Human rights in Egypt under the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

rev.diff:
Line 17: Line 17:
Five thousand six hundred civilians were tried in military tribunals in the last four months, according to HRW.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=1 June 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> One of them is Amr El Beheiry.<ref name="Associated">{{cite web|last=Associated |first=The |url=http://wvgazette.com/ap/ApInternational/201105270558 |title=Egypt activists plan 'Second Revolution' - AP World News - The Charleston Gazette - West Virginia News and Sports |publisher=Wvgazette.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Beheiry was arrested during a violent military dispersal of a sit-in at the parliament on 26 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/may/27/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527 |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials - Los Angeles Times |publisher=Articles.latimes.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> He was then referred to military court and after a swift trial without the presence of attorneys,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/451026 |title=Activists continue their battle against military trials as SCAF releases detainees | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> where he received a sentence of five years on thuggery charges despite the testimonies of many eyewitnesses who said he broke no laws.<ref>{{cite web|author=Evan Hill |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/05/2011519172611166398.html |title=Egypt's crackdown now wears camouflage - Features |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=20 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Amnesty International also has called for Beheiry's release.<ref name="Associated"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/05/19/egypt-human-rights-abuse-_n_864027.html |title=Egypt Human Rights Abuse Continues: Amnesty |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref>
Five thousand six hundred civilians were tried in military tribunals in the last four months, according to HRW.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=1 June 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> One of them is Amr El Beheiry.<ref name="Associated">{{cite web|last=Associated |first=The |url=http://wvgazette.com/ap/ApInternational/201105270558 |title=Egypt activists plan 'Second Revolution' - AP World News - The Charleston Gazette - West Virginia News and Sports |publisher=Wvgazette.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Beheiry was arrested during a violent military dispersal of a sit-in at the parliament on 26 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/may/27/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527 |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials - Los Angeles Times |publisher=Articles.latimes.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> He was then referred to military court and after a swift trial without the presence of attorneys,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/451026 |title=Activists continue their battle against military trials as SCAF releases detainees | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> where he received a sentence of five years on thuggery charges despite the testimonies of many eyewitnesses who said he broke no laws.<ref>{{cite web|author=Evan Hill |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/05/2011519172611166398.html |title=Egypt's crackdown now wears camouflage - Features |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=20 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Amnesty International also has called for Beheiry's release.<ref name="Associated"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/05/19/egypt-human-rights-abuse-_n_864027.html |title=Egypt Human Rights Abuse Continues: Amnesty |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-30}}</ref>

Another Activist the has been detained is Loai Nagati<ref name="ahram3">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/15393/Egypt/Politics-/Loai-Nagati-another-Egyptian-activist-to-face-mili.aspx |title=Loai Nagati: another Egyptian activist to face military trial - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-07-01}}</ref>.
